newsitem.title: USA: Farah plant in Ireland catches fire.
newsitem.headline: Farah plant in Ireland catches fire.

text.p: Farah Inc said on Tuesday that its leased factory in Galway, Ireland, caught fire, which is forcing the company to consider whether it should continue operations in Ireland.
No injuries were reported in the January 5 fire, but certain inventory and manufacturing equipment were damaged in the fire, Farah said.
The company said it believes that its losses are insured, but the company may post a charge up to $2.5 million if it closes its facilities in Ireland.
No exact cause to the fire has been determined, but faulty machinery is believed to have set the fire, Farah chief financial officer Russell Gibson said.
The Galway facility and Farah's Kiltimagh, Ireland facility produce 45 percent of the garments sold by Farah's U.K. subisidiary, Farah said.
Farah said it has increased commitments with outside contractors to make up for lost inventory.
The time involved in rebuilding the Galway facility and the impact on the Kiltimagh facility is forcing the company to evaluate its operations in Ireland, Farah said.
Farah said the fire is not expected to have a significant impact on its plans or future operating results.
Elsewhere, Farah said it plans to expand its John Henry products at Sears Roebuck & Co as well as its womenswear line.
Also, Farah said, its Australian results have set records in the first quarter, Farah said.
